text:
Hello everyone,

I'm using HubSpot CMS to create my website. I want to display my social media post on the website but if I use API's in the module it could be accessed through front end and it will be not good for the security of the site. Is there any way I could handle it and display my social media post on my website created on HubSpot CMS.

Thanks for sharing your thoughts,

Hello all, we are migrating a blog from Wordpress to HubSpot. We have run into the issue where images within the blog post are including the old srcset from the original site when we do an import. This is breaking all the images imported. Any ideas how to fix this?

For example, this is what gets imported:
`<img decoding="async" width="1024" height="1024" title="Blog Featured Images (21)" src="<https://www.HubSpotDOMAIN.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Imported_Blog_Media/Blog-Featured-Images-21.png?width=1024&height=1024&name=Blog-Featured-Images-21.png>" data-orig-src="<https://www.WORDPRESSDOMAIN.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Blog-Featured-Images-21-1024x1024.png>" alt="" class="lazyload img-responsive wp-image-1229" srcset="<https://static.hsstatic.net/BlogImporterAssetsUI/ex/missing-image.png> , <https://static.hsstatic.net/BlogImporterAssetsUI/ex/missing-image.png> " data-srcset="<https://www.WORDPRESSDOMAIN.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Blog-Featured-Images-21-200x200.png> 200w, <https://www.WORDPRESSDOMAIN.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Blog-Featured-Images-21-400x400.png> 400w, <https://www.WORDPRESSDOMAIN.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Blog-Featured-Images-21-600x600.png> 600w, <https://www.WORDPRESSDOMAIN.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Blog-Featured-Images-21-800x800.png> 800w, <https://www.WORDPRESSDOMAIN.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Blog-Featured-Images-21.png> 1080w" data-sizes="auto" data-orig-sizes="(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 600px">`
